result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew S Langley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrew S Langley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andrew S Langley was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:59 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew S Langley appeared by video in custody from DC jail.  Attorney Shelly Tomtschik in court for Andrew S Langley. V. Girard - Clerk 
22CF101, 22CT60, 22TR1485, 22TR1918, 22TR1917
Atty Tomtschik - there is an agreement, will need to waive prelim
State - plea to Ct 1 w/o repeater in 22CF101 - DRI Ct 2 & 22CT60 - dismiss  22TR1485, 22TR1918, 22TR1917
  w/held sent, 12 mo probation concurrent to any other serving. Credit for 2 days if revoked.
    Maintain absolute sobriety, Do AODA & follow through.  60 days jail w/ 30 days being stayed for use by Prob agent.  Not be in presence of any drug paraphernalia or controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Deft - waives personal appearance, waives prelim
Deft - enters a guilty plea to Ct 1 in 22CF101 w/o repeater
Parties stip facts support the plea

Court - finds plea & waivers free & voluntary,  finds probable cause & approves stip by parties
  in 22CF101 accepts plea to Ct 1 & finds the deft guilty 
     Orders:      w/held sent, 1 year probation concurrent to any other probation serving.   Credit for 2 days if revoked.
    Maintain absolute sobriety, Engage in evaluation of AODA & follow through.  60 days jail forthwith w/ 30 days held in abeyance for use by Prob agent, huber allowed.  Not be in presence of any drug paraphernalia or controlled substance without a valid prescription. Follow any recommendations of agent  May not possess any firearms.  $538 costs - 60 dtp or pp. Submit a DNA sample today.


 Dismiss Ct 2 & 22CT60 - dismiss  22TR1485, 22TR1918, 22TR1917
NOH - not resent - no valid address
